instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: 820 2915 battery not detected, won't charge
threads.message:
hey
it's a macbook pro 15 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a new battrery.
When I plugged in the power adapter it lights green but it does not charge. no orange light.
Just to add this. I tried to reset SMC with no luck.

thanks you

threads.title: 820 2915 battery not detected, won't charge
threads.message: Bad SMC or <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Could be battery indicator light too, so disconnect that first. Also check PPBUS voltage, it will probably be 12.3 instead of 12.6V

threads.title: 820 2915 battery not detected, won't charge
threads.message:
ok thanks,

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 10, 11 : 8.37v - 6.53v
is this normal ?

Regards

SÃ©bastien

threads.title: 820 2915 battery not detected, won't charge
threads.message: Pin 10 and 11 should never exceed 3.42v. Either you're measuring the wrong pin, or the ISL exploded and sent 16v to the SMC. When it does this it is usually dead and the machine is not turning on. Either way, what is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage to answer duke's question?

threads.title: 820 2915 battery not detected, won't charge
threads.message:
ok i understand ,
my macbook pro turn on with magsafe ,only green light

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 12.36v
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> : 16.04v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> :3.49v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>: 16.02v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> : 5.06v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> : 0v

threads.title: 820 2915 battery not detected, won't charge
threads.message: Again, bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> or SMC or both. Disconnect battery indicator and if that does not help replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> first and if that still not help then replace the SMC.
